1. Move to the location on your computer where you would like to clone your own repository into, using `cd` in the command line.
1. Clone your repository from GitHub to a different location on your computer.
1. Stage and commit changes in the new location (consider using a new branch).
1. Push the new changes to GitHub.
1. Fetch these new changes to the repository in the original location.
1. Delete your newly cloned repository.
